Description: A thin bracelet of brown chert: roughly rounded on the outer edge and flat on the inside.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan I and Memphis V' (London, 1913), 11, 22 and pl. III, 3. For parallels, see A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), nos. 200-2 and pl. 29; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXII, 42; XXXV, 57, 60-65; XXXVIII, 45; XLV, 14; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 16; G. A. Reisner, 'The early dynastic cemeteries of Naga-ed-Dêr' I, (California, 1908), 118 and pl. 9d; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 82-3 and pl. 100b.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (165)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
